item.description:
The soup is made with a blend of plain broth and crunch

A journey to Seosan's delicacies, from plain soup to traditional hotteok

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

The warm spring breeze blows softly and the hips are hilarious. The energy of spring multiplies the excitement of travel. It's a good season to go anywhere. The sea full of spring breeze is good and the market full of spring energy is good. If you add seasonal delicacies that will enhance your taste buds in spring, you can add icing. It would be better if the food is not common anywhere. So I chose Seosan, Chungnam, where the sea, the market, and seasonal delicacies are located.
What is soup?
If you are looking for Seosan on the west coast, many will taste Jukkumi Shabu Shabu or Urukhoe. If you add one, it's a local delicacy. The food is familiar to the Seosan people, but the name is strange to the outsiders. You can think of it as Maeuntang because it is a soup that is made with Urug. I might be worried that it will be rude. But the soup is a light dish with immaculate soup. It is closer to North Korea or Hwang than Thailand.
The main ingredient of the soup is Urugpo. Urug, also called zodiac rock, usually gives birth in spring. Because you gain weight before spawning, you can enjoy the spring season. There are many occasions where you can enjoy spring Uruk, which is full of flesh. Remove the guts and split in half and season with salt. Then, in the spring sunshine and wind, they usually dry for three days to complete Urugpo.
Now that the main character, Urugpo, is finished, let's boil the soup. You'll need a supporting shrimp sashimi, and prepare radish, green onions, and chopped garlic, which are usually served in a clear soup. Add tofu, which will add a lot of richness, and even dry peppers to give it a bitter flavor. Boil soup with rice water rather than plain water to make it taste stronger.
If you eat a piece of meat
In Urukukguk, it is 'one of the gods' that uses dried Urukpo instead of raw Urukpo. In the Seosan area, Urugpo was posted on a Buddhist memorial service, and it was said that the origin of Urugukguk was that the soup was eaten after it was finished. The dried fish makes the texture soft and chewy and doesn't have a fishy taste. The soup is so light that everyone can enjoy it. If you put the fluffy meat in your mouth, the flavor will spread. Once you drink a thick broth and bite a chubby meat, a bowl of rice disappears in no time.
Wagyu soup is made of rolled Urugpo
If you want to taste the soup, go to Seosan City's local restaurant or Samgilpohang. In Seosan city, there are several local restaurants serving local delicacies. The local restaurants, Sanhae Delicacy, and Seosan Flower Crab are popular among locals.
Restaurants for Sale
These restaurants specialize in Seosan's delicacies, such as Korean soup and crab soup, so you can enjoy the taste of local food. In addition, depending on the shop, they offer other specialties of Seosan, including crab soup, stew, and taeyeon. It is good to taste various local delicacies in one place.
Delicacies in Seosan, including Ecklonia and Gecko
Enjoy Seosan 9-mi Soup with Samgilpo Port
Samgilpohang is the best place to taste Urukhoe and Ukraint Soup against the sea. Samgilpo Port belongs to Seosan 9 View, and Urugukguk belongs to Seosan 9mi. In other words, you can enjoy special food in the beautiful scenery. Samgilpo Port, the gateway to the north of Seosan, is abundant with marine products.
Samgilpo Port
The large Uru-shaped statue built in the port and the annual Samgil-po-Luck poisoning festival represent Uru-san's main production area. In Samgilpohang area restaurant, you can easily find the menu. In the ship sashimi restaurant, the specialty of Samgil Pohang, Urug is the main character.
There is a large Uru statue in Samgilpo Port.
If you follow the signboard 'Flying Ship', the ships are lined up on the sea. Buying and selling fish is no different from any other fish market, but the space is the sea and the shop is a fishing boat.
You can buy sashimi at a sushi restaurant on board
The items sold here are mainly rockfish, songme, halibut, flatfish, and liver. Uruguay and flatfish can choose between wild and aquaculture. You can sashimi and go to a nearby restaurant to eat for a small table. After eating sashimi, you can try the local delicacy instead of spicy soup.
You can buy sashimi at a sushi restaurant on board
After a meal, take a walk through Samgilpohang. Sculptures installed in various places and seagulls flying in groups create a sight.
Sculptures are installed along the sea
Buy Urugpo and eat Hotteok, Seosan Eastern Market
You can buy Urugpo in Samgilpo Port, but if you go to Seosan Dongbu Market, you can find Urugpo and other seasonal ingredients. Seosan Eastern Market, located in the city center, is a traditional traditional market that opened in 1956. Being a central market in Seosan, I'm full of seafood and produce from the region. It's like looking around the fields and seas of Seosan even after a market round.
Seosan Dongbu Market, full of local seasonal specialties
The fish market corner is filled with fresh seafood such as jukkumi, clams, oysters and wild crab. It's as lively as the ocean. Enjoy the fun of the market with a great deal. There is a restaurant on the second floor of the fish market, where you can cook and eat seafood from the market.
Seosan Dongbu Market, full of local seasonal specialties
It's not just living seafood. As you walk inside the market, dried fish are a must. You can find various kinds of dried fish such as bakdae, flounder, and smelt. The most noticeable of these is Urugpo. Filled Urugpo is one of Seosan Eastern Market's most popular items. Aunt Merchant came to Seosan to buy Urugpo and try Urugup Soup or Urugpo Steaming. Once you're addicted to the taste, you keep buying only Urugpo.
We sell various dried fish such as Urugpo
Seosan Dongbu Market has many unique foods besides Urugpo. Emotions not common in other regions are noticeable. Eckloniagi looks like seaweed, but its color is clearer. Ecklonia vulgaris grows hard and grows wild, all of which are natural, with a rich sea scent and savory taste. You can eat it with oil like roasting, but you can just eat it.
Ecklonia can be found all over the market.
At this time, it is better to soothe soy sauce. Since soothe is mainly produced in Seosan, you can buy it all at the market until you can soothe it. Let's buy one more before we leave the market and buy it.
It can be found all over the market.
Grandmother Hotteok. If you enter the market place from the parking lot of the market, you will see the trade name 'Old Bakery'. You can feel the 'force' from the hotteok plate like the green drum. These days, it's hard to see these hot cakes. The oil is lightly brewed with a very light coat. The secret to the taste is the dough made with makgeolli and acorn jelly instead of chemical additives. The chewy and delicious taste is attractive. It is also fun to see the skillful work of grandmothers who have worked for decades.
'Old Bakery' and 'Marketing Original Ho-teok'
There is another famous hot rice cake at Seosan Dongbu Market. If you enter the alley where Sundae Gukbap and Kalguksu are gathered to the side of the direct market place, you will see 'Market aid Ho Tteok'. This is also a decades old hotteok house. Seosan is a shop where locals chew on their memories. The cast iron pan and the pot lid are impressive. Bake it in a pan, cover it with a pot, and steam it slightly until it is cooked. It uses less oil and makes the rice cake taste lighter. In both houses, two hot cakes cost 1,000 won. It is a good price. After eating a bowl of soup, enjoy a hot cake of Seosan Dongbu Market as a dessert.

Bright martial arts grounds in autumn

Where to ask for autumn leaves, the best season

Buyeo County, Chungnam, South Korea

To catch the end of the fall, he buryed the dead warriors to bury the last season. Yun Dae-nyeong, who wrote the novel, called Muryangsa as “the jangji (season) where the seasons sink.” When the leaves run out, it will be reminiscent of the sadness of a year. However, the bitterness of autumn, which is more abundant than gold, is swallowed up at once. Can we ask about the season that passed from Buyeo Muryangsa where Kim Si-ryong, the wind luck and genius poet of Joseon, spent his last years? .
Coriander
This fall, which has been bitten, goes to Buyeo in a month because the leaves are falling early. Fortunately, martial arts haven't completely dropped the fall yet. There's still a lot of energy last summer. Passing through the ticket office is one order soon. On the forehead of one order, there is a large board called 'Mansusan Muralosa'. It is a harmonious combination of 'unquantity', meaning immeasurable, and the name of the mountain, 'Mansu,' which means enjoying a long life. Muryangsa Temple is a millennial temple that was founded during King Munseong King (Unification 839 ~ 857). However, like most temples and architectural cultural assets in Korea, all martial arts disappeared during the Imjin War, but were rebuilt in 1623 (Art. 1) to reach today.
One order
Passing through a small valley and reaching the Cheonwangmun gate, a handsome party holder welcomes visitors to the right. The party holding means an elongated pole that hung the flag of the temple, or a holding seat that supported the party from left to right. This is a sign that the grounds of the temple begin here.

Ascending to the Cheonwangmun Gate, the paradise of Muyongsa Temple, the Five-storied Pagoda, and beyond are in the square frame of Cheonwangmun. Too stable angle. Even if you don't specialize in photography, you can naturally lift the camera. But the designer who designed this stunning view did not expose 100% of the paradise, the heart of the temple. The paradise roof was slightly covered with pine and zelkova branches. I sat and stood trying to take a picture to avoid the branches. 1 minute left? Ah! Paradise view from the Cheonwangmun
Slowly approach to paradise. When you reach the pine tree that covered the roof, you can see the stone lanterns, the five-storied pagoda, and the paradise. The stone lanterns, five-storied pagoda, and paradise of Muryuksa are all national treasures. It may seem as if it is a cultural asset, but the history of the cultural assets filled with signs and the knowledge of art history do not seem to help this autumn. So I don't deliberately go in detail. The dust of knowledge in my head seems to sit on the surface of the sticky emotion. Just look at the three treasures at a distance. From a large perspective, the gaze that originated from the ground raises a sense of ascension through the stone lanterns and the top of the pagoda, leading to the paradise ridge. In addition, five hundred and one thousand years of history, without serious damage and damage, adds dignity.
State and seat of majestic paradise war
Watch the paradise round from left to right. The boats of the pillars supporting the eccentric structure of the paradise are extraordinarily bulging. It is a commonly called shedding column. The exterior looks like two floors, but the inside of the paradise is a layered structure with no layers. It can be seen that this structure is not for the actual use of the second floor, but for the formality and dignity of the building.
Tombstone Pillar
Turn around the paradise backyard and stand under the maple tree in front of the fence on the right side of the building. It's good luck to come to the last martial arts afternoon. The sun has started to head west of Mansusan, and the warm autumn afternoon sun plentifully covers the grounds. Under the maple tree, the backlight is covered with maple leaves and the shutter is released. It's not wrong to say 'take photos with your feet'. As soon as the monk passes by.
The grounds of martial arts temple from the right
Kim Si-sook, a poor genius writer or owner of a free soul
There is one person you must meet in Muryangsa Temple. Kim Si-seon (1435 ~ 1493) is a monthly leader who is always introduced with nicknames such as Pung Un Ah, genius author, and Shin Dong. Pass the paradise and cross the small stream to the left to see the portrait of Kim Si-seop in Yeongjeonggak. Kim Si-sook did not recognize the seizure of the throne and lived as a monk and wife forever. He left the world at age 21 and wandered all over the country.
Let's take a look at the portrait of Kim Jung-shik. Yeongjung differs from the intense primary color discord commonly found in verses. It is also different from the portrait of the Joseon Squadron who dressed nicely in Gwanbok. Kim Si-seop in Yeongjung's hands are kept neatly in the sleeve, but he is frowning with frowns. That is why many critics say that they have captured the features of dissatisfied intellectuals who are dissatisfied with the world. You can see that. At twenty-one years of age, when King Sejo came to the throne, he burned all the books he had read and left the world and became a monk. However, Kim's life is not filled with bad luck, hoarding and criticism of society.
He left the world and toured Kanto and Hunan, enjoying scenery and writing poems. In his thirties, he spent six years in Gyeongju Geumosan, the current Gyeongju Namsan, dedicated to his work. The result of the immersion is Kum-O Myth, which is regarded as Korea's first Chinese novel. Was Kim Si-sook a poor genius who met the times wrongly? Or was he the owner of a free soul? Eventually, he sees his wandering as an alienation from power and mainstream or a will of free life. I give a small hint to that not easy problem. Kim Si-seop writes the motive of wandering in the preface of `` Every Month House ''

"I … In order to wander through the mountains and find a good view, I would boast of my friends to enjoy the poem, but I didn't think of getting into office with a sentence. It is a shame that one day, after being overwhelmed (the usurpation of the throne) by a man, a man can be born in this world and walk on the road. "

It is now covered with pampas grass, weeds, and shrubs, but excavations in 2000 confirmed the podium, headstone, and prestigious flag stamped with “Muyangsa”.

Going way again It immediately passes through Dosolam and reaches Taejoam. Only two toilets and benches are placed sparsely on the way to Taejoam. There are no magpies on this road, but only red persimmons are hung on persimmon trees that have run out of leaves. It's a sleek but simple way to take a quiet walk. Passing the garden to the right of Taejoam begins the full-scale hiking trail. If you plan to climb Mansu Mountain, you can climb along Taejoam Trail.

Exit Taejoam and leave the temple completely. There is one more thing to see before going to the parking lot. To the visitor who wants to leave, Muryangsa presents Kim Si-sook's bankruptcy. The fact that there are a lot of Buddhism, the tombs where Buddhist monks are buried, means that they have produced a lot of monks.

Muryangsa Budo-gun is on the way to Mujinam. Of all the defaults, Kim Si-sook's bankruptcy is the tallest. Both size and appearance are the most complete. The default of Kim Si-sook is a double base. item.title: Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea - Spring in the Forest and History, Seosan Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest
item.description:
Children learning nature at Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest

Spring in the Forest and History, Seosan Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest

Seosan, Chungnam, South Korea

I want to see the spring of trees and grassy forest. Enter the Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest next to the valley of Seosan-si, Chungcheongnam-do. The sound of water in Yonghyeon Valley flowing with the melting of ice and wild flowers reaching out over the fallen leaves announce spring. On the road to the recreation forest, you can also see the history of Baekje era.
Nature to learn by the five senses
Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest is located in the Gaya Mountains of Chungcheongnam-do. Gayasan 678m above sea level is a famous mountain in Chungcheongnam-do and is famous for retaining various cultural remains of the Baekje era. It was called Sangwangsan at that time, and it was named Gayasan in the Unification Silla era, when it set up Gayasa under the mountain. Although it is not a high mountain, many peaks, such as Gayabong, Seokmunbong, Okyangbong, and Jungbongbong, form the ridge, and the Yonghyeon Valley flows between the valleys. The valley, which is about 5 km long, is plentiful and the surrounding forests are dense and many people visit. Yonghyeon Valley is designated as a large national forest. Thanks to the forests and valleys that consist only of natural forests, the ecosystem is highly preserved. Natural monument No. 452 Golden Bat was found, and endangered species such as crayfish and fireflies are inhabited.
Yonsei-dong accommodation in Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest
The recreational forest has a variety of forest experience programs. Forest commentary, early childhood forest experience, forest school, forest healing five senses experience, and interior culture forest road trip. It runs from March to November every year, and anyone who wants to participate as well as recreational forest visitors can participate. Forest commentary starts at 10 am and 2 pm daily, and takes about 2 hours. Other programs are available after contacting the information office.
Forest Experience Center in Recreation Forest
In the woodworking room, which is located next to the management office, the living woodworking classroom is operated. Participation is possible after advance booking at 10am and 3pm. You can make small crafts with natural materials such as wood and stones.
Small crafts that can be experienced directly in the woodworking room
Accommodations in recreation forests include forest houses, coal alleys, and forest culture and recreation centers. There are also camping sites with 25 camping decks, 5 of which are the only loess thermal decks in Korea. The ocher thermal deck is made by laying ocher on the floor of a camping site to collect the heat in the middle of the day and catch the warmth for a long time. It's not as warm as installing an electric blanket, but you can feel the warmth, not the coldness of the bottom.
Ocher thermal deck campsite
When you visit here for camping, be careful of the hard floor, so you may have difficulty using the tent pack and the deck area is 3 × 3m. It's a good idea to get a rope to hold your tent in, and prepare a small to medium size tent for your floor space.
Ocher deck floor
Spring trails along forest trails and mountain trails
Various forest trails cross the Yonghyeon Valley, where the recreation forest is located. In the vicinity of the recreational forest, there is an ecological trail, a forest interpretation course, and a forest trail. In the distance, a hiking trail that leads to Mt. Naepo Culture Forest Road and Seosan Arame-gil can also pass near the recreational forest.
The ecological trail is a recreational forest path through the forest classroom, forest school, and forest experience field. The 500m side of the valley is decorated with bare foot paths. If you want to walk a little longer, a forest trail of about 3km is a good option. It is a path that leads to a wooden staircase through a wooden bridge installed on Yonghyeon Valley. Not walking long from the wooden bridge, she arrives in a forest resting place with several wooden chairs. Above it, you can see the four sides of the valley, which controls the level of the valley. Suriba is a rock with a strange shape formed at the top of the mountain. It is named after a pair of owls. May-July is the Owl's spawning season, so be careful not to make a fuss when you pass.
Forest trail starts in recreational forest
Naepo Culture Forest Trail is a walking path created along the remains of cultural relics throughout Seosan, Dangjin, Hongseong, and Yesan-gun. So far, it is the longest trekking course in Chungcheongnam-do. Among them, the section covering the recreational forest is one or two courses. It is one course that leads to Gaesimsa through the Recreational Forest Observation Deck. The two roads lead to Okyangbong along the Naepo Culture Forest Trail.
Naepo Culture Forest Trail through Suriba
Seosan Arame-gil is an eco-friendly trekking course created by Seosan. '아라' refers to the sea, and 'Me' refers to the mountain, which is a way that reflects the natural characteristics of Seosan that encompasses the sea and the mountain. A total of seven sections were created around attractions around Seosan. Not all courses are connected so it is good to walk for each section. Courses with recreational forests are divided into sections 1 and 1-1, which include five tourist attractions, including the Mae Ae Samseon Statue and Gaesimsa Temple.
Maa Eae Sansam Statue
Another historic site in spring
The Maae Yeo Samsam Statue, the second Gyeongsang Seogyeong, was designated as National Treasure No. 84 by the late Baekje. It is located about 3km away from Yonghyeon Natural Recreation Forest in the direction of Seoul along Yonghyeon Valley. If you go up the stairs about 300m from the valley, you will see the station and the entrance, and if you go up a little more, you can face the three-phase statue carved on the rock. In the center, there are statues of Buddha statues, Bodhisattva statues on the left, and Bangasa statues on the right. The face of Buddha is very gentle, but the smile looks different depending on the direction of light. The delicate sculpture of the Baekje era can be seen from the hem and sagging folds across the shoulders.
Mae Ae Samseon statue with delicate sculpture
Bowonsaji Temple, which was a Baekje era temple, is 2km away from Maaerae Samjon.
Borwonjiji Temple Holdings (Treasure No. 103)
Relics, stone temples, and five-storied pagoda, believed to have been built around the 10th century, are designated and protected as national treasures. In 1968, Baekje and Unification Silla era statues were found together.
Bowonsaji Five-storied Stone Tower (Treasure No. 104)
When you cross the Bowonsaji Temple, the trail to Gaesimsa begins. Walking along this road takes about 1.2 km to the entrance to the reconciliation gate and about 16 km to take the car.
Open review
Gaesimsa, the horseman of the budget county Sudeoksa Temple, was built in the 14th year of King Baekje's King Sejong (654) and belongs to the 4th Seosan. The buildings on the grounds were rebuilt in 1484 as they were lost in 1475. Among them, the base of Daeungjeon, a nationally designated cultural property, is said to have been built during the Baekje era.
Reconciliation
You have to be careful of the steps you take in the springtime to walk through nature and history. Small grasses and wildflowers lie softly over the leaves.
Wild flowers on the leaves

If you look for the time when the water comes in, you can try fishing on board. They are mainly caught, songme and flatfish. It is possible to get into the shallow water, catching ponies, mullets, crabs, shrimps, and other side nets in June when the water temperature starts to rise. After mid-May, octopus catching experiences await families. The bamboo primrose, a traditional primitive fishing method, is installed 20m long so that you can catch octopus by tumbling across the tidal flats.

You can wash freshly picked fresh clams clean and boil clam kalguksu or clam ramen. If you prepare vegetables and noodles in advance, you can enjoy simple meals with your children and enjoy more time.
Instant kalguksu boiled in fresh clam
Fishermen's Happiness Center also runs an experience program such as making taetae chocolate. Ecklonia is a rare seaweed that blooms only from December to April in a limited area of Seosan Garorim Bay. Picking is difficult, and the process of washing and drying by hand is also very expensive. It looks similar to Mae-sae-gi, but it is called 'sea vegetables of the sea' because of its stronger fragrance and excellent efficacy.

Walk through Sinmong Judo, Seosan Creative Art Village and Jungwang-ri Village
Pass the entrance to the experience village and follow the left hill to reach Seosan Creative Art Village. The unspoiled landscape of the village of Jungali Village leads to Jungwang-ri through the art village. Behind the vast landscape of Garorim Bay, the cozy village road is hidden. It's closer to a mountain village than a typical fishing village, so it's good to stroll around talking with your child.
Seosan Creative Art Village Exterior
The starting point of the walk is Seosan Creative Art Village. In 2009, it remodeled the Jungwang branch school of Buseong Elementary School, which was closed. Although it is named 'Simon Hwang Sukbong Modern Calligraphy Center', various art exhibitions are held every month in addition to calligraphy.
Hallway showroom
On the second and fourth Saturday of every month, paintings are held on plates and mugs. Paintings made with pottery pens can be grilled and taken directly to the kiln. The entrance fee to the museum and the experience fee are both free and the experience must be booked in advance.
Pottery works made by experienced visitors
Also worth seeing is the front yard of the museum, where soot and sailboats are located. Standing on the front yard observatory, the Everspring Plain and Jungwang-ri Village look like picturesque. The spring plain, which is also a migratory habitat, means 'to see all the time'. The scenery is varied throughout the four seasons.
Cutely decorated front yard
Follow the steps of the observatory to take a stroll in Jungwang-ri Village. Jungwang-ri is a small village where 140 households live in tight densities. Wall paintings and installations follow the concept of 'Walking through the Shinmong Judo Garden'. Seosan Jigok-myeon, where Jungwang-ri is located, is known as the hometown of the Korean electric painter, who drew the Mont Yudo Island. If <Mondedo Island> was the dream of Anpyeongdae, the landscapes of Jigok-myeon with only the landscape would not affect the style of the dog.
Jungang-ri Village Landscape
Walking from Seosan Creative Art Village to Jungang 1-ri Village Hall, you will find witty genre paintings, cute murals, old mills still in operation, and farm equipment warehouses. Roads embroidered with pale pink flowers and small landscapes caught in the square frame of the village signage add to the taste of walking.
